How to create URL links of specific dashboard views
Sometimes it is useful to generate a URL that captures a specific dashboard view. For instance, in some use cases, you may want to send an email to another person providing a URL linked to a dashboard configuration that captures data that is of specific interest. Another common use case comes when you want to share a URL with that specific data in another social network site.
The following guidance as to how these URLs can be created. There are generally two approaches: using the 'Global Dashboard' or using the 'Views Dashboards'.
1. Using the 'Global Dashboard'. Generating a URL of a specific snapshot in the Global Dashboard is pretty straightforward. Start by going to 'Explore' and click on 'Global inventory'. That will open the Global inventory dashboard. In that view, from the top selectors, choose the configuration you want to visualize and click on "Apply". For instance, let's say you are interested in finding all the edoovillages located in Tanzania that are managed by Labdoo Hub Rhein-Ruhr in Germany, your choice will take you to this URL:
https://www.labdoo.org/map?type%5B%5D=edoovillage&distance%5Blatitude%5D=&
distance%5Blongitude%5D=&distance%5Bsearch_distance%5D=100&
distance%5Bsearch_units%5D=km&country%5B%5D=tz&keys=&field_hub_target_id%5B%5D=431
Using the above steps, you can cut and paste this URL into an email and send it to someone else or post it in your favorite social site.
2. Using the 'View Dashboards'. Labdoo also provides a set of "View Dashboard" for the four main objects (doojects, dootrips, edoovillages and hubs). These dashboards provide information with finer granularity and are more interactive as data is provided real time. Due to this extra functionality, these dashboards don't provide a way to automatically generate URLs as is with the 'Global inventory'. However, special 'tricks' have been implemented into these dashboards so that users can manually create the same type of URLs. The following method is considered a bit more 'advanced', but if you try a couple of examples, you will see that it is easy to use and it can be very convenient when generating URLs to report your activity.
Let's start with an example. Let's say you want to generate a view of all the edoovillages located in Tanzania that are managed by Labdoo Hub Rhein-Ruhr in Germany located in Morocco (just like in the previous example) using the 'Edoovillage View Dashboard'. For that, go to 'Edoovillages' and click on 'View'. Then, modify the URL as follows:
https://www.labdoo.org/de/content/edoovillages-dashboard?c=tz&h=431
Just like in the previous example, you can now cut and paste this URL and send it to a friend over email or post it in your favorite social network wall.
In this example, notice how the additional parameters in the URL are created. The parameter 'c' stands for 'country' and is assigned the value of 'tz', which is the country code of Tanzania. To find out the codes of other countries, you can use the table in this Wikipedia entry: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2. The parameter 'h' stands for 'hub' and is assigned the value of 431. This corresponds to the hub identifier of the Labdoo Hub Rhein-Ruhr in Germany. This value can be found by going to that hub's page (the full list of hubs is available at https://www.labdoo.org/hubs) and by simple inspection of its URL. In this example, the URL of this hub is https://www.labdoo.org/hub?h=431, indicating that its hub id is indeed 431.
There are four keywords that you can use in the 'View Dashboards':
'c': The country code. 'h': The hub identifier. 'e': The edoovillage identifier. 'u': The user identifier.
You can play with any of these. Here is an another example: selecting all the doojects that are related to user 201, that are currently located in Kenya and that are assigned to edoovillage with identifier 1457 corresponds to this URL:
https://www.labdoo.org/content/doojects-dashboard?u=201&c=ke&e=1457
Notice that this technique is applicable to any of the four 'View Dashboards': doojects, dootrips, edoovillages and hubs.
